intro: Echium vulgare var. wierzbickii, commonly known as the Wierzbicki's thornflower, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
